Hi Emma — I checked things for you.

What I found
- The repository alicemiller/sorting_searching shows a pending collaborator invitation for emma.johnson@bluesparrowtech.com (so Alice has already invited you).
- I checked your GitHub-linked unread emails and there are no unread GitHub invitation emails in that inbox.

Why I couldn't accept it
- I don't have the ability to accept a GitHub collaborator invitation on your behalf unless you open the invitation link (from the email) or accept it while signed into your GitHub account. The APIs/tools available to me don’t include an action to accept a repository invitation for your account.

What to do next (fast options)
1. Check your email (including Spam/Junk) for an email from GitHub with a subject like "invitation to collaborate" and click the "View invitation" or "Accept invitation" link.
2. Sign in to GitHub and look for pending invitations:
   - Go to https://github.com/notifications and scan for an invitation notification.
   - Or sign in and click your profile → check the Notifications/Invitations area (GitHub shows pending repo/org invitations there).
3. If you still can’t find it, ask Alice to resend the invite. She can re-send from the repository’s "Manage access" / "Collaborators" settings.

If you want help now
- I can draft an email to Alice asking her to resend the invitation — if you provide her email address I can send it for you.
- Or I can re-check your inbox for specific search terms (e.g., "invitation", "GitHub", "alicemiller") if you want me to try again.
